intro: Vilfa drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's vilfa, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue to violet in color, and it blooms during the summer months. Vilfa drummondii is often found in open woodlands and canyons, where it thrives in full sun.
